utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And here’s another interesting weather fact.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Another? Great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Changes in jet streams can affect the speed at which the Earth rotates on its axis, so bad weather can actually make the day longer.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, there must be a hell of a storm somewhere.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Joke if you must, but you’re going to miss these moments. With Leonard home in a few days, this was your last time driving me to the grocery store.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, I will miss this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll tell you what, if my apples are mealy, we’ll hit the produce section for one last crazy blowout. Heck, you can even push the cart. Please don’t take my looking forward to Leonard’s return as criticism of the job you’ve been doing in his absence.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I won’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That criticism will come later in your report card.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I didn’t stay for the detention, I’m not gonna read the report card.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (in Penny’s apartment)
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Penny (screams)
utterance.content: Leonard! Hi!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Keep your voice down.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God. You weren’t supposed to be here till Sunday.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We finished the experiment early, so I thought I’d come home and surprise you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my gosh, why are we whispering?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I didn’t tell Sheldon, so we could have a few days alone.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, that is so romantic.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, sure, that’s why I did it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I just cannot believe you’re here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: Penny, it’s your lucky day. Three of the eggs are clearly not jumbo. Grab your keys.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, Stuart, I was wondering if you could help me find something.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Happy to, unless it’s hope or a reason to live.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, you make me laugh, sad clown. Anyhoo, Leonard will be back in a couple days and I need a welcome home gift for him. As he’s been at sea, perhaps something with a nautical theme might be appropriate.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Okay, well, I don’t know how much you want to spend, but I do have this pretty cool Aquaman statue.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aquaman? Oh, this isn’t a gag gift, Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yeah, just as well. It’s a pretty rare piece. I’d rather just sell it to a real collector.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m a real collector. How rare is it?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, I shouldn’t even have mentioned it. How about a Batman squirt gun?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t try and trick me into buying something I don’t want. Now let’s talk Aquaman.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What were they thinking, putting Doctor Octopus’s mind in Spider-Man’s body?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I’ve been quite enjoying that. It combines all the superhero fun of Spider-Man with all the body-switching shenanigans of Freaky Friday. Both versions, original and Lohan.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Both versions: original and Lohan. You’re an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, what’s your problem?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I’ve been kind of snippy lately. It’s probably this stupid diet I’m on.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why are you on a diet?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ve put on a couple pounds. Had to buy these pants in the men’s section.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, we’ve all seen your mom. That Butterball turkey was bound to come home to roost.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Twelve hundred dollars. That’s my final offer.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: All right, Sheldon, you win. I’m sure Leonard is gonna love this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, right, a present for Leonard. You better throw in that squirt gun.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Ooh, yeah, I don’t know. This squirt gun, it’s, uh, it’s pretty rare.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And this is me doing the Titanic pose on the boat.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And, oh, that’s me getting rescued after I fell in.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Oh, that’s the pizza.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yep. Here’s some money.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And I’m gonna hit the head. That’s what us salty sea dogs say when we have to go pee-pee.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Pizza guy
utterance.content: Twenty-two fifty.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, here’s, uh, twenty-five. Keep the change.

utterance.speaker: Pizza guy
utterance.content: Seriously? I just walked up, like, four flights of stairs.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Okay. Well, here’s, um, thirty something cents and a promise I won’t call your boss and tell him you reek of marijuana.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, Penny, I see you’ve ordered pizza. I have Chinese food.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s nice.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, that’s a rather earthy cologne. My uncle used to wear that. Perhaps we can enjoy one last meal together before Leonard returns.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, thanks, but I kind of feel like eating alone tonight, so…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you sure? With your Italian pizza and my Chinese noodles, we could play Marco Polo. I mean, of course, a re-enactment of a meal in the life of Marco Polo the Venetian explorer, not Marco Polo the terrifying water sport.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, it sounds fun, but no thanks. Have a good night!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What, now, do you have company?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. No, no, no. You know what? The toilet’s been doing that. I called the building manager, so…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I can take a look at it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m quite familiar with plumbing. Not to brag, but I spent most of fifth grade with my head in a toilet.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, no, no, no. You know what, Sheldon, it’s okay. You don’t have to go into the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s curious. If there’s no one here, why are there two glasses of wine on the table?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Well, you know, I, I’ve got two hands and a bit of a drinking problem.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course. Ask a silly question.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s odd.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There are takeout containers in the trash can.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So? That’s my dinner from last night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s odd is they’re in the trash can.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Look, honey, I promise there’s no one’s here. I‘ve had a long day. I just want to have a quiet dinner by myself.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, very well. I’m no stranger to enjoying the pleasures of solitude. Oh!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Have you gotten Leonard a welcome-home gift yet?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, great. Do you want to go halfsies on a two hundred dollar squirt gun?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hi, honey.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I made some brownies. You want one?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re kidding, right? I mean, you know I’m trying to lose weight. God, I thought we were partners in this marriage.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We are. Stop it. And for the last time, you’re not fat.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really? Tell that to the bathroom scale, ’cause one of you is lying.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Fine, forget I asked. How was dinner at your mom’s?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Awful. I had to rub her ointment all over her again.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Why can’t she do it?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: ‘Cause we’ve got a deeply unhealthy relationship. Which reminds me, do you think you can get any samples of this from work? This was supposed to last her a month, but they didn’t take into account the square footage of her back.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Let me see. How long have you been putting this on her?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know. Few weeks. Why?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: This is really strong oestrogen cream. Please tell me you’ve been wearing gloves.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Like these swollen sausages could fit in gloves.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howie, the oestrogen’s getting absorbed by your skin. That’s why you’ve been all bloated and moody and a giant pain in the ass.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re full of oestrogen and you don’t act like that.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That’s ’cause I’m a woman. I’ve had years of practice riding the dragon.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine. I’ll wear gloves next time.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s still gonna take a few weeks for the hormones to leave your system.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I feel so stupid. And fat.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s okay. You still look great to me. In fact, why don’t we go in the bedroom and I’ll prove it to you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sex? Really? I mean, that’s just your solution to everything.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, and here’s a fun thing. I worked it out so that there are two different words for spoon, planko and janko. Planko is a spoon with food, janko is a spoon without food. Janko is spelled with a silent ptang. Sheldon, you’re not even listening to the rules of my made-up language.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, I am.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Then what does tweepadock mean?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, elephant?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Lucky guess.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I’m just distracted by something that happened over at Penny’s.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I fear Penny is being unfaithful to Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She claimed to be alone when there was obviously someone else in her apartment. I have no choice but to assume the worst, given Leonard’s lengthy sea voyage and her famously ravenous nether regions.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t think Penny would cheat on Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, really? She and I once had a staring contest. She clapped really loud and made me blink. It’s a small leap from there to sexual infidelity.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re being ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy, there were Chinese food containers in the trash can.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Poor Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Do you hear anything?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I hear a woman’s voice.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Is it Penny?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, it’s you. All right, I hear whispering and giggling. Now I think I hear kissing.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah, like you know what kissing sounds like.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There’s kissing in Star Trek, smarty-pants.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Let me listen. Sounds like Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please. Why would Leonard come home early and waste his time kissing Penny when he could be hanging out with his best buddy? Yeah, that’s it. I’m catching her in the act.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, Sheldon, don’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aha.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, you cannot just barge in here like that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Right. Penny. Penny. Penny. Are you going to answer the door or should I open it and say aha again?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Sheldon. I should’ve told you I was back. I just wanted to have a couple days alone with Penny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no, I should apologize. Uh, I never realized to what extent our friendship was a burden to you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That is not fair. I complain about what a burden it is at least once a month.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, let’s not sugarcoat this. You find me finicky, pedantic and annoying.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, he doesn’t.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I actually have used those exact words before. In that order.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, Leonard, I think it’s high time you and I address the tweepadock in the room.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Please leave me out of this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. Leonard, there’s no need for you to pretend to like me anymore.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, I said I was sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, no, you save your apologies for after you’ve had disappointing coitus with Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It was fine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, this is silly. Hey, um, I brought you back a little present from my trip, huh? It’s that sailor cap that you wanted. It’s neat, huh?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You honestly think you can buy back my friendship with a cheap souvenir?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t. I really don’t. Just try it on. Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hello, sailor.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ooh, now we’re talking.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me. This changes nothing. Except the Halloween costume I’m wearing this year. Amy, you’re going to be Olive Oyl. Lay off the doughnuts.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thanks for coming over.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No problem. Ooh, you made little sandwiches.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s cucumber and cream cheese. That’s turkey and loganberry. And don’t tell my hips, but I’m warming up a brie in the oven.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Nice. So, mmm. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, well, I’ve been reading up on all the side effects you can get from oestrogen, and, I need you to be honest with me. Do my boobs look bigger to you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, it’s kind of hard to tell.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Come on, Raj, it’s a yes or no question.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m not sure. Um, wait. Jump up and down, let’s see if they jiggle. Uh, no, I, I still can’t tell, uh, oh, you know what? Okay, uh, give me some of this.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Do you want my help or not?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, yup. See, see, that, that looks like, that looks like they could be bigger. But you know, I bet, I bet when I do it, mine do the same thing.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, they kind of do.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hmm. Uh, let me see something.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, easy, my nipples are sensitive.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh. Sorry, sorry, uh, okay. I mean, yeah, maybe.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, let me feel. No, I am definitely up a cup size.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, but, but they’re very firm, so you’ve got that going for you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You think?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah, very perky.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank you. I really needed to hear that today. Ooh, brie’s ready.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good morning.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So am I driving you to work or are you still mad at me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’d like a ride. Assuming you actually do take me to work.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Where do you think I would take you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who knows? Uh, you said you’d be home yesterday, but you came home three days ago. You say you’re taking me to work, but for all I know, I’ll end up in a deserted amusement park. Or a cornfield maze. Or a back alley dog fight. You tell me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m going to work. You can come if you want.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. By the way, you have something on your shirt.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I don’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hurts, doesn’t it? You know, I find myself wondering if anything you’ve ever told me is true.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I didn’t make it back. The ship sank, I’m in hell.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You say you’re from New Jersey, but how can I believe you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why would anyone claim to be from New Jersey if they weren’t?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, I’ll give you that one.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, I said I was sorry. What else do you want from me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I want you to admit that what you did was wrong.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine. What I did was wrong.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I wish I could believe you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know what? I’m not driving you to work, because you’re incredibly annoying.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You say one thing and do the other, so then you are driving me and you find me a delight.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Stop it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Keep it up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello. So I guess you’re really holding up the other four fingers?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hey, what are you doing here so early?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Driving Sheldon to work.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: He’s still mad at Leonard, huh?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, he’s mad at you, too. He says you’re the succubus who led his friend astray.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know what succubus is, but it has suck in it, so that can’t be good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thought I heard you out here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You don’t get a hey. You get a hmm.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, don’t be like that. We had so much fun together the last couple of months.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re right. Which makes your betrayal all the more devastating.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I let you buy feminine hygiene products with my supermarket club card. You have any idea the kind of coupons I’m going to get in the mail now?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, your fight’s with Leonard. Penny’s got nothing to do…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Careful, Amy. The friend of my enemy’s girlfriend is my enemy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. You’re either with me or against me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You want to take the bus to work?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Maybe there’s a third option.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: FYI, I had a doughnut for breakfast, you jerk.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So now we’re just waiting for the data from the ship to be crunched, but the numbers look pretty promising.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s so great. If you guys prove the existence of Unruh radiation… Hey, hey, hey, hey. My eyes are up here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Howard, Raj. Judas.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know what? You’re a crazy person.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A crazy person with a long memory, and if all goes according to plan, a robot army.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Stop it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Or a mutant army. It depends on how my Kickstarter goes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I said, stop it. Now, listen to me. You two aren’t just friends. You’re best friends. And that’s a beautiful thing. I mean, Leonard, you know why he’s so mad at you? It’s ’cause he missed you. Yeah, and as his friend, you should be happy he has love in his life. As I do. This man held my breast the other day and I love him for it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: A little loud, dude.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, can we please put aside these petty differences and just be glad we’re here together?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I suppose so.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, it wasn’t anything weird. It was just to see how big they were.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And then Leonard took me to the barber and the dentist, and then to cap off the perfect day, the Los Angeles Bureau of Weights and Measures.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I thought the measures were going to be the stars of the show, turns out it was the weights.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m so glad you guys are friends again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And I’m glad you and I are friends again, too.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Aw.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Which reminds me. This came in the mail, and I want you to have it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Fifty cents off Vagisil.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Think of me when you apply it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, can I just say, I’ve missed all of us hanging out together.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Me, too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Um, since when can Koothrappali talk in front of the girls without a beer?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, that happened right after you left.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And no one told me?

utterance.speaker: Howard (crying)
utterance.content: Can’t believe we forgot to tell him.

utterance.speaker: Penny (handing Howard the Vagisil coupon)
utterance.content: Think of Sheldon when you apply it.
